justification: The data clump with key 28 is chosen because it indicates a significant duplication of class fields across two test classes, which may imply that there is a common testing setup or context that could be abstracted into a shared fixture or base test class. This would not only reduce duplication but also centralize common test setup, making maintenance and understanding of the tests easier. Refactoring this could improve test architecture and potentially reveal shared concepts that can be abstracted into utility methods or classes, leading to cleaner and more maintainable test code.
